page.title: 14Interview(cont.)
page.content: French's Garage is the oldest garage in Seaford.Saxon Lodge was built in 1685.Beyond the site of The Ritz Cinema,is the area where the Pedlars were impounded if they had been in Seaford for too long.Opposite The Wellington Hotel was a pump(as it was near the old quay) where the ships refilled their water.Sutton Drove was the main road in those days. During the time that Mrs. Goussen has been in Seaford the seafront has changed a lot.Cliton Place used to be lined with trees and Broad Street used to have privately owned houses in it, and only a few shops,it is quite the opposite now. She sees a change in the type of people that live in Seaford and she thinks that it is not a pretty town but it has character.The retired play Golf,Tennis or work for Organisations.
